result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew P. Pofahl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Andrew P. Pofahl is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Andrew P. Pofahl was found guilty of Burglary-Room w/in Building, etc. [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(f).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 78 days served if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Review Hearing set for 12/10/14 @ 330pm to start Drug Court.  Deft accepted into Drug Court - Deft must appear on Wednesdays at 330pm.

Ct.2 -Dismissed  kmk
for Drug Court
Co of Kenosha Drug Court Program Particpation Agreement
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge - Ct 1

Defendant Andrew P. Pofahl appeared with Attorney William Paul Michel.  Defendant in custody.  Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk: J. Mattner.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance.  Defendant entered a plea of Guilty to Ct 1-Burglalry, Repeater; found guilty by the court.  Defendant admits to prior convictions.  Cts 2, 3 & 4 were dismissed outright.  Parties waived the PSI report.  Def. has a pending SAR hrg before Br 7 on 12/8/14.

Ct 1:  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 2 1/2 years w/conditions.  78 days sentence credit if revoked.  Court costs ordered.  No restitution requested.  Federal firearms warning and voter ineligibility status given to the defendant.  Submit a DNA sample previously submitted; pay surcharge.  Def. accepted into the Drug Court Program and to report to Drug Court every Wednesday at 3:30 pm commencing 12/10/14.  Appeal rights given.
Plea Hrg set for 11/6/14 at 3:30 pm before Br 4, Drug Court.  The 11/6/14 STC hrg before Br 6 removed from the court's calendar.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney W Michel II.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Michel acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty pleas.  Atty Michel states the deft is being accepted into the drug court.  STC 11/6/14 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.
